basics.description: **Note:** Please refer to the following before installing the solution: • Review the solution [Release Notes](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/tree/master/Solutions/Threat%20Intelligence/ReleaseNotes.md) • There may be [known issues](https://aka.ms/sentinelsolutionsknownissues) pertaining to this Solution, please refer to them before installing. The Threat Intelligence solution contains data connectors for import of supported STIX objects into Microsoft Sentinel, analytic rules for matching TI data with event data, workbook, and hunting queries. Threat indicators can be malicious IP's, URL's, filehashes, domains, email addresses etc. **Data Connectors:** 5, **Workbooks:** 1, **Analytic Rules:** 53, **Hunting Queries:** 5 [Learn more about Microsoft Sentinel](https://aka.ms/azuresentinel) | [Learn more about Solutions](https://aka.ms/azuresentinelsolutionsdoc)

metadata.hidden: Hiding location, we get it from the log analytics workspace

basics.name: getLAWorkspace
basics.toolTip: This filters by workspaces that exist in the Resource Group selected

basics.name: workspace
basics.label: Workspace
basics.toolTip: This dropdown will list only workspace that exists in the Resource Group selected

options.text: This Solution installs the data connector for Threat Intelligence. You can get Threat Intelligence custom log data in your Microsoft Sentinel workspace. After installing the solution, configure and enable this data connector by following guidance in Manage solution view.
The data connectors installed are:

elements.name: DC1
elements.label: (1)		Threat Intelligence Platforms

options.text: Use this connector to send threat indicators to Microsoft Sentinel from your Threat Intelligence Platform (TIP), such as Threat Connect, Palo Alto Networks MindMeld, MISP, or other integrated applications.

elements.name: DC2
elements.label: (2)		Threat Intelligence - TAXII

options.text: Use this connector to bring in threat intelligence to Microsoft Sentinel from a TAXII 2.0 or 2.1 server.

elements.name: DC3
elements.label: (3)		Threat Intelligence Upload Indicators API

options.text: Microsoft Sentinel offer a data plane API to bring in threat intelligence from your Threat Intelligence Platform (TIP), such as Threat Connect, Palo Alto Networks MineMeld, MISP, or other integrated applications. Threat indicators can include IP addresses, domains, URLs, file hashes and email addresses.

elements.name: DC4
elements.label: (4)		Microsoft Defender Threat Intelligence

options.text: Microsoft Sentinel provides you the capability to import threat intelligence generated by Microsoft to enable monitoring, alerting and hunting. Use this data connector to import Indicators of Compromise (IOCs) from Microsoft Defender Threat Intelligence (MDTI) into Microsoft Sentinel. Threat indicators can include IP addresses, domains, URLs, and file hashes, etc.

elements.name: DC5
elements.label: (5)		Premium Microsoft Defender Threat Intelligence

options.text: Microsoft Sentinel provides you the capability to import threat intelligence generated by Microsoft to enable monitoring, alerting and hunting. Use this data connector to import Indicators of Compromise (IOCs) from Microsoft Defender Threat Intelligence (MDTI) into Microsoft Sentinel. Threat indicators can include IP addresses, domains, URLs, and file hashes, etc. Note: This is a paid connector. To use and ingest data from it, please purchase the "MDTI API Access" SKU from the Partner Center.
After installing the solution, configure and enable these data connectors by following guidance in Manage solution view.

link.label: Learn more about connecting data sources

options.text: This solution installs workbook(s) to help you gain insights into the telemetry collected in Microsoft Sentinel. After installing the solution, start using the workbook in Manage solution view.

elements.name: workbook1
elements.label: Threat Intelligence

options.text: Gain insights into threat indicators ingestion and search for indicators at scale across Microsoft 1st Party, 3rd Party, On-Premises, Hybrid, and Multi-Cloud Workloads. Indicators Search facilitates a simple interface for finding IP, File, Hash, Sender and more across your data. Seamless pivots to correlate indicators with Microsoft Sentinel: Incidents to make your threat intelligence actionable.
This solution installs the following analytic rule templates. After installing the solution, create and enable analytic rules in Manage solution view.

elements.name: analytic1
elements.label: TI map Domain entity to PaloAlto CommonSecurityLog

options.text: Identifies a match in PaloAlto CommonSecurityLog table from any Domain IOC from TI

elements.name: analytic2
elements.label: TI Map Domain Entity to DeviceNetworkEvents

options.text: This query identifies any Domain indicators of compromise (IOCs) from threat intelligence (TI) by searching for matches in DeviceNetworkEvents.

elements.name: analytic3
elements.label: TI map Domain entity to DnsEvents

options.text: Identifies a match in DnsEvents from any Domain IOC from TI

elements.name: analytic4
elements.label: TI map Domain entity to EmailEvents

options.text: Identifies a match in EmailEvents table from any Domain IOC from TI

elements.name: analytic5
elements.label: TI map Domain entity to EmailUrlInfo

options.text: Identifies a match in EmailUrlInfo table from any Domain IOC from TI.

elements.name: analytic6
elements.label: TI map Domain entity to Web Session Events (ASIM Web Session schema)

options.text: This rule identifies Web Sessions for which the target URL hostname is a known IoC. This rule uses the [Advanced Security Information Model (ASIM)](https:/aka.ms/AboutASIM) and supports any web session source that complies with ASIM.

elements.name: analytic7
elements.label: TI map Domain entity to PaloAlto

options.text: Identifies a match in Palo Alto data in CommonSecurityLog table from any Domain IOC from TI

elements.name: analytic8
elements.label: TI map Domain entity to SecurityAlert

options.text: Identifies a match in SecurityAlert table from any Domain IOC from TI

elements.name: analytic9
elements.label: TI map Domain entity to Syslog

options.text: Identifies a match in Syslog table from any Domain IOC from TI

elements.name: analytic10
elements.label: TI map Email entity to AzureActivity

options.text: Identifies a match in AzureActivity table from any Email IOC from TI

elements.name: analytic11
elements.label: TI map Email entity to EmailEvents

options.text: Identifies a match in EmailEvents table from any Email IOC from TI

elements.name: analytic12
elements.label: TI map Email entity to OfficeActivity

options.text: Identifies a match in OfficeActivity table from any Email IOC from TI

elements.name: analytic13
elements.label: TI map Email entity to PaloAlto CommonSecurityLog

options.text: Identifies a match in CommonSecurityLog table from any Email IOC from TI

elements.name: analytic14
elements.label: TI map Email entity to SecurityAlert

options.text: Identifies a match in SecurityAlert table from any Email IOC from TI which will extend coverage to datatypes such as MCAS, StorageThreatProtection and many others

elements.name: analytic15
elements.label: TI map Email entity to SecurityEvent

options.text: Identifies a match in SecurityEvent table from any Email IOC from TI

elements.name: analytic16
elements.label: TI map Email entity to SigninLogs

options.text: Identifies a match in SigninLogs table from any Email IOC from TI

elements.name: analytic17
elements.label: TI map File Hash to CommonSecurityLog Event

options.text: Identifies a match in CommonSecurityLog Event data from any FileHash IOC from TI

elements.name: analytic18
elements.label: TI map File Hash to DeviceFileEvents Event

options.text: Identifies a match in DeviceFileEvents Event data from any FileHash IOC from TI

elements.name: analytic19
elements.label: TI map File Hash to Security Event

options.text: Identifies a match in Security Event data from any File Hash IOC from TI

elements.name: analytic20
elements.label: TI map IP entity to AppServiceHTTPLogs

options.text: Identifies a match in AppServiceHTTPLogs from any IP IOC from TI

elements.name: analytic21
elements.label: TI map IP entity to AWSCloudTrail

options.text: Identifies a match in AWSCloudTrail from any IP IOC from TI

elements.name: analytic22
elements.label: TI Map IP Entity to AzureActivity

options.text: This query maps any IP indicators of compromise (IOCs) from threat intelligence (TI), by searching for matches in AzureActivity.

elements.name: analytic23
elements.label: TI map IP entity to AzureFirewall

options.text: Identifies a match in AzureFirewall (NetworkRule & ApplicationRule Logs) from any IP IOC from TI

elements.name: analytic24
elements.label: TI map IP entity to Azure Key Vault logs

options.text: Identifies a match in Azure Key Vault logs from any IP IOC from TI

elements.name: analytic25
elements.label: TI map IP entity to AzureNetworkAnalytics_CL (NSG Flow Logs)

options.text: Identifies a match in AzureNetworkAnalytics_CL (NSG Flow Logs) from any IP IOC from TI that was Allowed

elements.name: analytic26
elements.label: TI Map IP Entity to Azure SQL Security Audit Events

options.text: This query maps any IP indicators of compromise (IOCs) from threat intelligence (TI), by searching for matches in SQL Security Audit Events.

elements.name: analytic27
elements.label: TI Map IP Entity to CommonSecurityLog

options.text: This query maps any IP indicators of compromise (IOCs) from threat intelligence (TI), by searching for matches in CommonSecurityLog.

elements.name: analytic28
elements.label: TI Map IP Entity to DeviceNetworkEvents

options.text: Identifies a match in DeviceNetworkEvents Event data from any IP Indicator from TI.

elements.name: analytic29
elements.label: TI Map IP Entity to DnsEvents

options.text: This query maps any IP indicators of compromise (IOCs) from threat intelligence (TI), by searching for matches in DnsEvents.

elements.name: analytic30
elements.label: TI map IP entity to Web Session Events (ASIM Web Session schema)

options.text: This rule identifies Web Sessions for which the source IP address is a known IoC. This rule uses the [Advanced Security Information Model (ASIM)](https://aka.ms/AboutASIM) and supports any web session source that complies with ASIM.

elements.name: analytic31
elements.label: TI map IP entity to OfficeActivity

options.text: This query maps any IP indicators of compromise (IOCs) from threat intelligence (TI), by searching for matches in OfficeActivity.

elements.name: analytic32
elements.label: TI Map IP Entity to SigninLogs

options.text: This query maps any IP indicators of compromise (IOCs) from threat intelligence (TI), by searching for matches in SigninLogs.

elements.name: analytic33
elements.label: TI Map IP Entity to VMConnection

options.text: This query maps any IP indicators of compromise (IOCs) from threat intelligence (TI), by searching for matches in VMConnection.

elements.name: analytic34
elements.label: TI Map IP Entity to W3CIISLog

options.text: This query maps any IP indicators of compromise (IOCs) from threat intelligence (TI), by searching for matches in W3CIISLog.

elements.name: analytic35
elements.label: TI Map URL Entity to AuditLogs

options.text: This query identifies any URL indicators of compromise (IOCs) from threat intelligence (TI) by searching for matches in AuditLogs.

elements.name: analytic36
elements.label: TI Map URL Entity to DeviceNetworkEvents

options.text: This query identifies any URL indicators of compromise (IOCs) from threat intelligence (TI) by searching for matches in DeviceNetworkEvents.

elements.name: analytic37
elements.label: TI Map URL Entity to EmailUrlInfo

options.text: This query identifies any URL indicators of compromise (IOCs) from threat intelligence (TI) by searching for matches in EmailUrlInfo.

elements.name: analytic38
elements.label: TI Map URL Entity to OfficeActivity Data [Deprecated]

options.text: This query is Deprecated as its filter conditions will never yield results. This query identifies any URL indicators of compromise (IOCs) from threat intelligence (TI) by searching for matches in OfficeActivity data.

elements.name: analytic39
elements.label: TI Map URL Entity to PaloAlto Data

options.text: This query identifies any URL indicators of compromise (IOCs) from threat intelligence (TI) by searching for matches in PaloAlto Data.

elements.name: analytic40
elements.label: TI Map URL Entity to SecurityAlert Data

options.text: This query identifies any URL indicators of compromise (IOCs) from threat intelligence (TI) by searching for matches in SecurityAlert data.

elements.name: analytic41
elements.label: TI Map URL Entity to Syslog Data

options.text: This query identifies any URL indicators of compromise (IOCs) from threat intelligence (TI) by searching for matches in Syslog data.

elements.name: analytic42
elements.label: TI Map URL Entity to UrlClickEvents

options.text: This query identifies any URL indicators of compromise (IOCs) from threat intelligence (TI) by searching for matches in UrlClickEvents.

elements.name: analytic43
elements.label: TI Map IP Entity to Duo Security

options.text: This query maps any IP indicators of compromise (IOCs) from threat intelligence (TI), by searching for matches in DuoSecurity.

elements.name: analytic44
elements.label: TI map Domain entity to Dns Events (ASIM DNS Schema)

options.text:
Identifies a match in DNS events from any Domain IOC from TI
This analytic rule uses [ASIM](https://aka.ms/AboutASIM) and supports any built-in or custom source that supports the ASIM DNS schema'

elements.name: analytic45
elements.label: TI map IP entity to DNS Events (ASIM DNS schema)

options.text: This rule identifies DNS requests for which response IP address is a known IoC. This analytic rule uses [ASIM](https://aka.ms/AboutASIM) and supports any built-in or custom source that supports the ASIM DNS schema.

elements.name: analytic46
elements.label: TI map IP entity to Network Session Events (ASIM Network Session schema)

options.text: This rule identifies a match Network Sessions for which the source or destination IP address is a known IoC. This analytic rule uses [ASIM](https://aka.ms/AboutASIM) and supports any built-in or custom source that supports the ASIM NetworkSession schema

elements.name: analytic47
elements.label: TI map IP entity to GitHub_CL

options.text: Identifies a match in GitHub_CL table from any IP IOC from TI

elements.name: analytic48
elements.label: Preview - TI map Domain entity to Cloud App Events

options.text: Identifies compromises and attacks and detect malicious activities in one's domain entity from TI.

elements.name: analytic49
elements.label: Preview - TI map Email entity to Cloud App Events

options.text: Identifies compromises and attacks and detect malicious activities in one's email entity from TI

elements.name: analytic50
elements.label: Preview - TI map File Hash entity to Cloud App Events

options.text: Identifies compromises and attacks and detect malicious activities in one's file hash entity from TI

elements.name: analytic51
elements.label: Preview - TI map IP entity to Cloud App Events

options.text: Identifies compromises and attacks and detect malicious activities in one's IP entity from TI

elements.name: analytic52
elements.label: Preview - TI map URL entity to Cloud App Events

options.text: Identifies compromises and attacks and detect malicious activities in one's URL entity from TI

elements.name: analytic53
elements.label: TI map IP entity to Workday(ASimAuditEventLogs)

options.text: Detects a match in Workday activity from any IP Indicator of Compromise (IOC) provided by Threat Intelligence (TI).
This solution installs the following hunting queries. After installing the solution, run these hunting queries to hunt for threats in Manage solution view.

elements.name: huntingquery1
elements.label: TI Map File Entity to OfficeActivity Event

options.text: This query finds matches in OfficeActivity Event data for known FileName Indicators of Compromise from Threat Intelligence sources. FileName matches may produce false positives, so use this for hunting rather than real-time detection. This hunting query depends on Office365 ThreatIntelligence ThreatIntelligenceTaxii MicrosoftDefenderThreatIntelligence data connector (OfficeActivity ThreatIntelligenceIndicator ThreatIntelligenceIndicator ThreatIntelligenceIndicator Parser or Table)

elements.name: huntingquery2
elements.label: TI Map File Entity to Security Event

options.text: This query finds matches in Security Event data for known FileName Indicators of Compromise from Threat Intelligence sources. FileName matches may produce false positives, so use this for hunting rather than real-time detection. This hunting query depends on SecurityEvents ThreatIntelligence ThreatIntelligenceTaxii MicrosoftDefenderThreatIntelligence data connector (SecurityEvent ThreatIntelligenceIndicator ThreatIntelligenceIndicator ThreatIntelligenceIndicator Parser or Table)

elements.name: huntingquery3
elements.label: TI Map File Entity to Syslog Event

options.text: This query finds matches in Syslog Event data for known FileName Indicators of Compromise from Threat Intelligence sources. FileName matches may produce false positives, so use this for hunting rather than real-time detection. This hunting query depends on Syslog ThreatIntelligence ThreatIntelligenceTaxii MicrosoftDefenderThreatIntelligence data connector (Syslog ThreatIntelligenceIndicator ThreatIntelligenceIndicator ThreatIntelligenceIndicator Parser or Table)

elements.name: huntingquery4
elements.label: TI Map File Entity to VMConnection Event

options.text: This query finds matches in VMConnection Event data for known FileName Indicators of Compromise from Threat Intelligence sources. FileName matches may produce false positives, so use this for hunting rather than real-time detection. This hunting query depends on AzureMonitor(VMInsights) ThreatIntelligence ThreatIntelligenceTaxii MicrosoftDefenderThreatIntelligence data connector (VMConnection ThreatIntelligenceIndicator ThreatIntelligenceIndicator ThreatIntelligenceIndicator Parser or Table)

elements.name: huntingquery5
elements.label: TI Map File Entity to WireData Event

options.text: This query finds matches in WireData Event data for known FileName Indicators of Compromise from Threat Intelligence sources. FileName matches may produce false positives, so use this for hunting rather than real-time detection. This hunting query depends on AzureMonitor(WireData) ThreatIntelligence ThreatIntelligenceTaxii MicrosoftDefenderThreatIntelligence data connector (WireData ThreatIntelligenceIndicator ThreatIntelligenceIndicator ThreatIntelligenceIndicator Parser or Table)
